## Meet the penguins

```{r, echo = F}
# Read data
penguins <- read.csv("data/data.csv")

```

The `penguins` data from the [palmerpenguins](https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/) package contains size measurements for `300+44` penguins from three species observed on three islands in the Palmer Archipelago, Antarctica. There are `r sum(penguins$Species=='Chinstrap penguin (Pygoscelis antarctica)')` penguins of type Chinstrap, `r sum(penguins$Species=='Gentoo penguin (Pygoscelis papua)')` Gentoo and `r sum(penguins$Species=='Adelie Penguin (Pygoscelis adeliae)')` Adelie.

Again, the total of penguins in the data set is `r do_addition(sum(as.numeric(penguins$Species=='Chinstrap penguin (Pygoscelis antarctica)')), as.numeric(sum(penguins$Species=='Gentoo penguin (Pygoscelis papua)'))) + sum(penguins$Species=='Adelie Penguin (Pygoscelis adeliae)')`.



![@noauthor_palmerpenguins_nodate](https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/reference/figures/lter_penguins.png)

## Results

The plot below shows the relationship between flipper and bill lengths of these penguins.

\vspace{0.5cm} 

```{r, echo = F, warning = F}

# Plot penguins
ggplot(penguins, 
       aes(x = `Flipper.Length..mm.`, y = `Culmen.Length..mm.`)) +
        geom_point(aes(color = Species, shape = Species)) +
        scale_color_manual(values = c("darkorange","purple","cyan4")) +
        labs(
                title = "Flipper and Culmen length",
                subtitle = "Dimensions for penguins at Palmer Station LTER",
                x = "Flipper length (mm)", y = "Culmen length (mm)",
                color = "Penguin species", shape = "Penguin species"
        ) +
        theme_minimal(base_family = "Times")

```

```{r, echo = F, warning = F}

quarto_render("my-reproducible-manuscript.qmd", output_format = "docx")
```
